newsitem.title: HONG KONG: S&P assigns rating to GE Capital Finance HK$ FRN.
newsitem.headline: S&P assigns rating to GE Capital Finance HK$ FRN.

text.p: Standard & Poor's said on Thursday it has assigned its "A" long-term local currency credit rating to General Electric Capital Finance Ltd's (GECF) HK$200 million subordinated floating rate notes due 2006.
The notes are rated a notch lower than GECF's senior, unsecured, local currency rating of "A plus" due to the subordination of the notes.
S&P said the ratings on Hong Kong-incorporated GECF chiefly reflect the financial strength of its parent, General Electric Capital Corp (GECC), which is rated "AAA" by the agency.
The ratings also reflect the strategic importance of the subsidiary to the parent and the good financial profile of GECF, it added.
The company's market position was small with reported total assets of HK$4.5 billion (US$582 million) at year-end 1995, it said.

S&P said the local currency rating outlook is stable, reflecting the expected results from the reorientation of the company's strategic focus, ongoing productivity gains, and lightening of underwriting standards.
